title: Do you make art?
content:
After years of being scared of it I've now started to paint with watercolors just for fun. I suck at it, but I might get better with time. It's fun and surprisingly much easier than "painting" on the computer with Painter or Photoshop, only there's no undo so I need to gain lot of experience.

Maybe this question have been asked before, but I'd like to know if there's any of you who paints or does any art that's not on the computer. I'm mainly interested in drawing with charcoal or pastels, painting with oil, watercolor etc. The ordinary colored pencils are good tools for drawing too, but you can't make a mess with them (at least not that easily) so it's not that interesting for me at the moment.

title: Re: Do you make art?
content:
[img]http://img91.imageshack.us/img91/9796/feathergram13nl.png[/img]

I first carved and "tooled" it (basically attempting to make it more life-like sort of) before painting and finishing it. I did not design it; I worked from a picture, so it's not original.If the universe were toast, what jelly would you put on it?

title: I do indeed.
content:
I was given a bunch of watercolour materials about a week ago, including a nifty felt-tip pen with a flexible tip so it's more like working with a paintbrush. I haven't got around to using them yet, though I've been meaning to get stuck into some watercolour endeavours for a long time now.

I'll keep ye posted if I learn any useful stuff that might help ye. I've done very little with paint or textury artwork of any sort for over a decade, mostly concentrating on [url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/jdraw/index.html]these[/url] kinds of works.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Art:
content:
Well... In a general sense of art (not on the computer):

I write stories, I do a bit of poetry, and compose music.

I am an avarage 8th grade painter, I hate water colors though. I can draw pretty good, and have done a few charcoals (though... their not that good - I tend to make my portraits look like the subject was through a coal mine immediatly before they posed)

I have a friend named Tim. He is an awesome poet, and writes the words to some of my songs (BTW - I play the piano, and have an awesome keyboard I have hooked up to my PC), he actually practices drawing, and paiting. Right now, he's duplicating a peice of art for art class in impressionistic style. I chose a landscape, which had a blue sky, and green grass. I used only 2 colors; blue, and green. Wham; as easy as painting plywood; though not a Monet. He is doing a more complicated picture, and is putting Renoir to shame.

I may not... but then I ask Tim's help. We make a good team, because we have different skills we fuse togather, and can make something really cool out of it; like a song.

-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Art:
content:
Spleen, you've got quite many "file not found"s on that page! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] The ones I could see; nice work!

Well, personally I don't like watercolours, but oilpainting is fun. Although, haven't done that for years, but I'm about to do something when I'm not too lazy. (No, and can't draw.)[url=http://www.keengrid.net/]keengrid.net[/url]

title: Re: Art:
content:
What was that Rose carved out of? I've never thought of creating such thing but it looks nice! Maybe I should give it a try someday.

Spleen, your creature drawings are cute and the first few terrains that could be viewed shows that you've spent some time with them, but what about the broken links? We want more! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]

I'll post something as soon as I'm statisfied with it if you'd like to see it. I did my first painting only yesterday so it was just experimenting with the tools.

Watercolor is not an easy medium, I don't see why do they want people to learn that in school. At least here. It makes people hate art so they won't even start thinking about what'd they be capable of.

content:

title: Re: Art:
content:
I used to draw a lot. Anime, water colours, some printing (I hated it), but mostly free hand pencil. I started when I was like 4 yrs old, until 7th grade...

Unfortunetly, an event happened that caused me to destroy every single work I'd ever done. And I've only drawn in art class since then.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Art:
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Z-1:
What was that Rose carved out of?[hr][/quote]
Well, I carved it in (nothing was removed, in other words) leather. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] After cutting the lines I had traced, I beveled them on the proper side to give the appearance that the petals overlap. Various other tools were used to give it more dimension.

IIRC, the picture makes it look better than it was.

title: Re: New one
content:
Impressive! It is good, quite good. You seem to have a grasp on coloring, something that I just can't seem to do. One question though:

Do you use a pencil/some other tool to sketch out the form before painting?

Best of luck on your future endeavors!-----------------------
[img]http://i34.photobucket.com/albums/d134/Galaxieretter/shikadimastercopy.gif[/img]

title: Re: New one
content: I do sketch the form before I paint with a pencil made especially for this kind of work. I don't exactly know how is the pencil called. It's made by Denwert (an english maker, but it may be available anywhere) and it has "sketching" and "Light Wash" written on it and an image of a brush. The important part is that it can be softened by water and it completely disappeares by the end of the painting.[hr]The human brain is not user-friendly...
